MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home was not captured by Hezbollah drone in August 2024
==================================================================================================================================

**The image dates back to 2019.**
---------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--9d48e97d86b7---------------------------------------)

4 min read

·

Aug 28, 2024

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------clap_footer------------------)

\--

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F9d48e97d86b7&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Fmissing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7&source=---header_actions--9d48e97d86b7---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

A [post](https://archive.ph/LKIoV)
 shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home, taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024, is MISSING CONTEXT.

The post reads, “BREAKING Netanyahu’s residence in Caesarea has been filmed by a drone belonging to the Lebanese Hezbollah — Israel Hayom.”

The image was also shared on X (formerly Twitter) with similar claims in a [post](https://archive.ph/7EBDu)
 reading, “Netanyahu’s residence has been filmed by a Hezbollah drone…On target.”

According to media [reports](https://www.aa.com.tr/en/middle-east/hezbollah-drone-suspected-of-filming-netanyahus-home-report/3307013)
, a suspected [Hezbollah](https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/what-hezbollah)
 drone that was purportedly filming Netanyahu’s home in Caesarea on 18 August 2024 was dismissed as a false alarm. The Lebanese militant group allied with [Hamas](https://apnews.com/article/hamas-hezbollah-houthis-iran-militant-groups-745bfc36e23997ee3f0bc499a9f5c16d)
 began striking Israel in October 2023 in [solidarity](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/is-hezbollah-israel-conflict-about-spiral-2024-07-28/)
 with Palestinians in the Gaza Strip in the [ongoing](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2024/8/22/israels-war-on-gaza-live-mass-exodus-as-israel-expands-ground-invasion)
 war in the Middle East.

A Google Lens reverse image [search](https://archive.ph/BOoER)
 established the image in question predates current events.

The image was featured in a 25 June 2020 [article](https://www.timesofisrael.com/why-exactly-have-israelis-been-ordered-to-pay-netanyahus-taxes/)
 by _Times of Israel_ with the headline, “Why, exactly, have Israelis been ordered to pay Netanyahu’s taxes?”

The image, labelled as a screenshot, is attributed to _Kan_ public broadcaster and captioned: “Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s private residence in Caesarea.”

_KAN_ featured the image in a YouTube [video](https://youtu.be/k_VMJvSd8v0)
 uploaded on 1 July 2019.

The video’s title, translated from Hebrew, reads, “The villa in Caesarea: The Netanyahu family insists that the state finance the sealing works.”

PesaCheck has looked into a post shared on Threads with an image purportedly of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s home filmed by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024 and finds it to be MISSING CONTEXT.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Peris Gachahi_**](https://twitter.com/PerisMimmo)
 _and edited by PesaCheck senior copy editor_ [**_Mary Mutisya_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/mary-mutisya-522078198/)
 _and chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
_._

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
**_._**

_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image in the claim is not from August 2024. It dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019. <image:53>

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence. The page contains articles about the residence, including articles about protests, security, and maintenance. The page also contains images of the residence <image:53>. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
reverse_search(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
```

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/missing-context-this-image-of-israeli-prime-minister-benjamin-netanyahus-home-was-not-captured-by-9d48e97d86b7): Found exact image on website with title: MISSING CONTEXT: This image of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin ...
Content: The image in the claim is not from August 2024. It dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019. <image:53>


From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/topic/prime-ministers-residence/): Found exact image on website with title: Prime Minister's Residence - The Times of Israel
Content: The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence. The page contains articles about the residence, including articles about protests, security, and maintenance. The page also contains images of the residence <image:53>. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.


From [Source](https://beyondhighbrow.substack.com/): Found exact image on website with title: Beyond Highbrow | Robert Lindsay | Substack
Content: NONE


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image (<image:53>) is of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house. The image dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019.

The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence, which contains articles and images of the residence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.

A drone targets the Israeli prime minister's house during new barrages with Hezbollah
=====================================================================================

  

Updated October 19, 20248:20 PM ET Originally published October 19, 20248:58 AM ET

By 

[The Associated Press](https://www.npr.org/people/101453150/the-associated-press)

  !Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday. It wasn't clear if the house was hit.

“The proxies of Iran who today tried to assassinate me and my wife made a bitter mistake,” Netanyahu said.

[!Yahya Sinwar, a founder of Hamas' military wing, talks during a rally in Khan Younis, southern Gaza Strip, in 2011. <image:4618>

Smoke rises from an Israeli airstrike on Dahiyeh, in the southern suburb of Beirut, Lebanon, on Saturday. <image:4619>](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)

### [Middle East conflict](https://www.npr.org/series/1205445976/middle-east-crisis)

### [What does Yahya Sinwar's death mean for the Middle East?](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/18/nx-s1-5157608/israel-hamas-sinwar-gaza-future)

Hezbollah didn't claim responsibility but said it carried out several rocket attacks on Israel. Group of Seven defense ministers warned against escalation and “all-out war.”  

### New exchange of airstrikes

Israel’s military said about 200 projectiles were fired from Lebanon, a day after Hezbollah said it planned to send more guided missiles and exploding drones. Netanyahu says Israel's military will fight until the hostages are released, and will remain in Gaza to prevent a severely weakened Hamas from regrouping.

Israel’s retaliatory offensive in Gaza has killed more than 42,000 Palestinians, according to local health authorities, who don't distinguish combatants from civilians but say more than half the dead are women and children.

More strikes pounded Gaza on Saturday, and Palestinian communications company Paltel said they knocked out internet networks in the north.

[!Palestinians evacuate the Jabalia refugee camp and the Sheikh Radwan and Abu Iskandar neighborhoods in the northern Gaza Strip on Saturday."

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk): 
Content: "[](#maincontent)

[World](https://www.cnn.com/world)
 [Middle East](https://www.cnn.com/world/middle-east)
 • 3 min read

Video shows damage to Netanyahu’s beach house as Hezbollah claims drone attack
==============================================================================

[](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/irene-nasser)

By [Irene Nasser](https://www.cnn.com/profiles/irene-nasser)
 and Isaac Yee, CNN

3 min read

Updated 2:10 AM EDT, Wed October 23, 2024

[](mailto:?subject=CNN%20content%20share&body=Check%20out%20this%20article%3A%0Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.cnn.com%2F2024%2F10%2F23%2Fmiddleeast%2Fvideo-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk "Share with email")

Link Copied!

Follow:

The Middle East [See your latest updates](/follow?iid=follow_see_all_article&source=acq_web_experiments_follow_card-social-bar-all)

![This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.](https://media.cnn.com/api/v1/images/stellar/prod/xgafrp8bxqaaau7f.jpg?c=16x9&q=h_833,w_1480,c_fill)

This image shows damage to the exterior of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, on October 22, 2024.

From Social Media

CNN  — 

The beachside home of Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu was damaged in a drone strike claimed by Hezbollah, video footage geolocated by CNN shows, in an attack that penetrated deep inside Israel even as the militant group reels from sustained Israeli bombardment.

Netanyahu and his wife were not at home at the time of Saturday’s attack in the coastal city of Caesarea and no-one was injured, according to Israeli officials.

But the incident has raised questions about how the drone evaded Israel’s air defenses even after Hezbollah’s leadership has been decimated and as Israel’s military ramps up strikes across swathes of Lebanon.

CNN affiliate Kan 11 published an exterior photo of the house showing damage to a window with cracks and what appears to be burn marks. One additional UAV hit a structure in the area of Caesarea.”

The Israeli prime minister’s spokesperson confirmed the attack that day, but it was not until Tuesday that Israeli authorities admitted the drone had hit the house.

Hezbollah claimed “full and exclusive responsibility” on Tuesday for the attack, and issued a warning: “If we haven’t reached you yet, know that between us and you are the days, the nights, and the battlefield.”

In a post on X following the attack on Saturday, Netanyahu blamed “agents of Iran” for the strike, and said they “made a bitter mistake.”

“I say to the Iranians and their partners in the axis of evil: Anyone who harms the citizens of the State of Israel will pay a heavy price,” Netanyahu added.

Iran denied involvement in the drone attack, stating the operation was “carried out by Hezbollah.”

Drones have proved something of a low-tech but deadly menace to Israel.

The country’s air defense systems are impressive, intercepting and destroying most projectiles fired towards the country. The IDF said two drones were fired and that while one was intercepted, the other was not – due to what it said was a human error.

The attack on Netanyahu’s house comes at a time of a widening regional conflagration in the Middle East. Israel still has not carried out its expected response to Iran for a ballistic missile attack earlier this month and is continuing its military campaign against Hezbollah in Lebanon.

The incident also comes as the US is investigating a leak of highly classified US intelligence about Israel’s plans for retaliation against Iran following an October 1 Iranian missile barrage targeting Israel.

_CNN’s Eyad Kourdi and Ivana Kottasová contributed reporting._

Related video See aftermath of deadly drone attack on Israeli base](/2024/10/14/world/video/idf-troops-hezbollah-drone-attack-israel-lebanon-robertson-digvid)

A [deadly attack](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/14/middleeast/hezbollah-attack-israel-weaknesses-drones-intl-cmd/index.html)
 by Hezbollah earlier in October killed four soldiers in a military base some 40 miles into Israel from the border.

In July, a drone launched by Iran-backed Houthi rebels from Yemen killed one man and injured at least 10 others in Tel Aviv. Kan 11 reported that the damaged window was that of a bedroom.

“Allowed for publication: the UAV that Hezbollah launched and hit the Prime Minister’s house in Caesarea,” the caption of the photo shared by the reporter reads.

Video geolocated by CNN shows the same scene of the exterior window in what seems to be the backyard of the house.

The Israeli military on Saturday said “three UAVs were identified crossing from Lebanon into Israeli territory."

Netanyahu’s house hit by drone as Israel and Hezbollah trade blows in Lebanon
=============================================================================

This article is more than 9 months old

Shia group has not claimed responsibility for attack on PM’s home but says it fired several barrages of rockets

Benjamin Netanyahu’s house in the seaside town of Caesarea was hit by a drone on Saturday, causing superficial damage and no casualties, as Israel’s wars in Gaza and Lebanon rage unabated after the death [of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/18/hamas-recognises-death-of-leader-yahya-sinwar-but-vows-to-keep-fighting)
.

The Israeli government said that one of the prime minister’s three homes was targeted by three drones, two of which were intercepted, and that neither Netanyahu nor his wife, Sara, were home at the time.

In a statement on Saturday night, [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://www.theguardian.com/world/benjamin-netanyahu)
 said: “The attempt by Iran’s proxy Hezbollah to assassinate me and my wife today was a grave mistake.”

Netanyahu vowed that Iran and its proxies would “pay a heavy price” and said Israel would continue to “eliminate the terrorists and those who dispatch them”.

Israeli media later published a video of the prime minister walking in a park.

Israel’s air raid system was not triggered by the lightweight drones, which are difficult to detect. The Observer is now owned and operated by Tortoise Media.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
reverse_search(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Israel': 0.17, 'Mexico': 0.15, 'Tunisia': 0.11, 'Malta': 0.1, 'Palestine': 0.07, 'Bermuda': 0.05, 'Jordan': 0.05, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.04, 'Dominican Republic': 0.03, 'Pakistan': 0.03}

### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house. The image dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019.

The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence, which contains articles and images of the residence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.


### Evidence from `web_search`
Multiple sources report that Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024. The attacks were claimed by Hezbollah. The NPR article, published on October 19, 2024, mentions the drone targeted Netanyahu's house. The CNN article, published on October 23, 2024, states that the house was damaged in the attack. The Guardian also reported on the attack on October 19, 2024.

The articles can be found here: [https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel), [https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk), and [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon). The CNN article includes an image of the damage to the house <image:k>. The Guardian article includes a photograph of the scene <image:4623>. The NPR article includes images <image:4621>, <image:4618>, <image:4619>.


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is partially accurate. The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house. However, the image dates back to 2019, according to the reverse image search results. The web search results confirm that Netanyahu's house was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024, but the provided image is not from that event. Therefore, the claim is misleading.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
reverse_search(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Israel': 0.17, 'Mexico': 0.15, 'Tunisia': 0.11, 'Malta': 0.1, 'Palestine': 0.07, 'Bermuda': 0.05, 'Jordan': 0.05, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.04, 'Dominican Republic': 0.03, 'Pakistan': 0.03}

### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house. The image dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019.

The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence, which contains articles and images of the residence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.


### Evidence from `web_search`
Multiple sources report that Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024. The attacks were claimed by Hezbollah. The NPR article, published on October 19, 2024, mentions the drone targeted Netanyahu's house. The CNN article, published on October 23, 2024, states that the house was damaged in the attack. The Guardian also reported on the attack on October 19, 2024.

The articles can be found here: [https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel), [https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk), and [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon). The CNN article includes an image of the damage to the house <image:k>. The Guardian article includes a photograph of the scene <image:4623>. The NPR article includes images <image:4621>, <image:4618>, <image:4619>.


## Elaboration
The claim is partially accurate. The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house. However, the image dates back to 2019, according to the reverse image search results. The web search results confirm that Netanyahu's house was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024, but the provided image is not from that event. Therefore, the claim is misleading.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house, but it is not from a Hezbollah drone attack in August 2024. The image is older, and the drone attack occurred in October 2024.

`false`
_________________________



SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:53> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu's house taken by a Hezbollah drone in August 2024."

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:53>)
reverse_search(<image:53>)
web_search("Benjamin Netanyahu house drone image")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Israel': 0.17, 'Mexico': 0.15, 'Tunisia': 0.11, 'Malta': 0.1, 'Palestine': 0.07, 'Bermuda': 0.05, 'Jordan': 0.05, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.04, 'Dominican Republic': 0.03, 'Pakistan': 0.03}

### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:53>) is of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's house. The image dates back to 2019 and was featured in a June 25, 2020 article by Times of Israel. The image was also featured in a YouTube video uploaded on July 1, 2019.

The Times of Israel has a topic page dedicated to the Prime Minister's Residence, which contains articles and images of the residence. The Times of Israel published an article on October 21, 2024, discussing a Hezbollah drone attack on Netanyahu's home.


### Evidence from `web_search`
Multiple sources report that Benjamin Netanyahu's house in Caesarea, Israel, was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024. The attacks were claimed by Hezbollah. The NPR article, published on October 19, 2024, mentions the drone targeted Netanyahu's house. The CNN article, published on October 23, 2024, states that the house was damaged in the attack. The Guardian also reported on the attack on October 19, 2024.

The articles can be found here: [https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel), [https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk), and [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon). The CNN article includes an image of the damage to the house <image:k>. The Guardian article includes a photograph of the scene <image:4623>. The NPR article includes images <image:4621>, <image:4618>, <image:4619>.


## Elaboration
The claim is partially accurate. The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house. However, the image dates back to 2019, according to the reverse image search results. The web search results confirm that Netanyahu's house was targeted by a drone strike in October 2024, but the provided image is not from that event. Therefore, the claim is misleading.


## Final Judgement
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house, but it is not from a Hezbollah drone attack in August 2024. The image is older, and the drone attack occurred in October 2024.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image is of Benjamin Netanyahu's house, but it predates the alleged Hezbollah drone attack. The image dates back to 2019, as confirmed by a reverse image search and articles from the Times of Israel. While the house was targeted by a drone in October 2024, as reported by [NPR](https://www.npr.org/2024/10/19/nx-s1-5158375/netanyahu-house-drone-israel), [CNN](https://www.cnn.com/2024/10/23/middleeast/video-netanyahu-beach-hezbollah-drone-attack-intl-hnk), and [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2024/oct/19/netanyahus-house-hit-by-drone-as-israel-and-hezbollah-trade-blows-in-lebanon), the provided image is not related to that event.

_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
web_search("Hezbollah Benjamin Netanyahu office")
```
_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
web_search("Hezbollah Benjamin Netanyahu office")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...

Citizens need accurate information to make sound decisions. PesaCheck is Africa’s largest indigenous fact-checking organisation, debunking misleading claims and deciphering the often confusing numbers quoted by public figures in 16 African countries.

[Follow publication](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fsubscribe%2Fcollection%2Fpesa-check&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&collection=PesaCheck&collectionId=ab41f21aa9a9&source=post_page---post_publication_sidebar-ab41f21aa9a9-396f43e817da---------------------post_publication_sidebar------------------)

ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is fabricated
=====================================================================

**The authentic photo of the Israeli PM Netanyahu is from 2009.**
-----------------------------------------------------------------

[![PesaCheck](https://miro.medium.com/v2/resize:fill:64:64/0*ttzO0bKO1LLBQdao.jpg)](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

[PesaCheck](https://medium.com/@PesaCheck?source=post_page---byline--396f43e817da---------------------------------------)

·

1 day ago

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fvote%2Fpesa-check%2F396f43e817da&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&user=PesaCheck&userId=c75918c2df6e&source=---header_actions--396f43e817da---------------------clap_footer------------------)

[](https://medium.com/m/signin?actionUrl=https%3A%2F%2Fmedium.com%2F_%2Fbookmark%2Fp%2F396f43e817da&operation=register&redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fpesacheck.org%2Faltered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da&source=---header_actions--396f43e817da---------------------bookmark_footer------------------)

Listen

Share

A [photo published on X](https://archive.is/0PvDl)
 (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister (PM) Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office is ALTERED.

The post alleges that Iran’s Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) captured and published the image, accompanied by a warning reading, “Do not test our capabilities — we intend to keep you living in a state of constant anxiety!”

However, a reverse image search revealed that the photo has [been online](https://archive.is/JmjZG)
 since 2019 and was not shared by IRGC in 2025, as the post claims.

Furthermore, a Yandex image search showed that the photo was [edited](https://www.malumatfurus.org/netanyahu-makam-odasi/)
 to make it appear as though Netanyahu was under surveillance. The [original image](https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/news-photo/in-this-handout-photo-benjamin-netanyahu-head-of-the-right-news-photo/84719768?adppopup=true)
, taken on 8 February 2009, in Jerusalem, shows Netanyahu with his father, Ben Zion Netanyahu.

A FotoForensics Error Level Analysis (ELA) reveals that the photo has been altered, as indicated by inconsistencies and noise in the image.

PesaCheck has looked into a photo on X (formerly Twitter) claiming to show Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu being surveilled by Iran from inside his office and finds it to have been ALTERED.

_This post is part of an ongoing series of PesaCheck fact-checks examining content marked as_ **_potential misinformation_** _on Facebook and other social media platforms._

[_By partnering with Facebook and similar social media platforms_](/pesacheck-and-facebook-partner-to-fight-misinformation-in-kenya-d6a45ee70c18?gi=d2cb1ae7440)
_, third-party fact-checking organisations like PesaCheck are helping to sort fact from fiction. We do this by giving the public deeper insight and context to posts they see in their social media feeds._

_Have you spotted what you think is fake or false information on Facebook?_ [_Here’s how you can report_](https://www.facebook.com/help/572838089565953?helpref=faq_content)
_. And,_ [_here’s_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _more information on_ [_PesaCheck’s methodology_](/our-methodology-f3d77521a1ee)
 _for fact-checking questionable content._

_This fact-check was written by Senior PesaCheck fact-checker_ [**_Pius Enywaru_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/enywaru/)
 _and edited by PesaCheck copy editor_ [**_Paul Tajuba_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-tajuba-93b62a82/)
 _and_ _chief copy editor_ [**_Stephen Ndegwa_**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/stephen-ndegwa-0b32b126b/)
**_._**

_The article was approved for publication by PesaCheck managing editor_ [**_Doreen Wainainah_**](https://twitter.com/DoreenWainainah)
**_._**

_PesaCheck is East Africa’s first public finance fact-checking initiative. It was co-founded by_ [**_Catherine Gicheru_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/catherine-gicheru)
 _and_ [**_Justin Arenstein_**](https://www.icfj.org/our-work/knight/profiles/justin-arenstein)
_, and is being incubated by the continent’s largest civic technology and data journalism accelerator:_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_. It seeks to help the public separate fact from fiction in public pronouncements about the numbers that shape our world, with a special emphasis on pronouncements about public finances that shape government’s delivery of Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) public services, such as healthcare, rural development and access to water / sanitation._ [**_PesaCheck_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
 _also tests the accuracy of media reportage. To find out more about the project, visit_ [**_pesacheck.org_**](https://pesacheck.org/)
_._

_PesaCheck is an initiative of_ [**_Code for Africa_**](https://codeforafrica.org/)
_, through its_ [**_innovateAFRICA fund_**](https://innovateafrica.fund/)
_, with support from_ [**_Deutsche Welle Akademie_**](https://www.dw.com/en/dw-akademie/about-us/)
_, in partnership with a coalition of local African media and other civic watchdog organisations._

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

The Lebanese armed group Hezbollah has claimed responsibility for a drone attack last week on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s holiday residence in Caesarea in northern Israel.

“The Islamic Resistance claims responsibility for the Caesarea operation and targeting Netanyahu’s home,” the head of Hezbollah’s media office, Mohammad Afif, said at a news conference on Tuesday.

One of three drones launched from Lebanon [hit Netanyahu’s holiday residence](/news/2024/10/19/drone-hits-netanyahus-home-as-hezbollah-rockets-target-northern-israel)
 on Saturday. ![The head of Hezbollah's media office, Mohammad Afif, gestures as he speaks during a press conference, in Ghobeiry, Lebanon October 22, 2024, in this still image from a video. His spokesperson said the prime minister was not in the vicinity at the time of the attack and there were no casualties.

Afif said that if in the previous attack Netanyahu was not hurt, “the coming days and nights and the \[battle\]fields are between us.” Afif appeared to be hinting that Hezbollah might carry out similar attempts in the future.

He also said there would be no negotiations with Israel while fighting continues and acknowledged that some Hezbollah fighters have been taken captive by the Israeli military.

“Israel does not adhere to the ethics of war, and we hold it responsible for the safety of our prisoners in its custody,” Afif said.

In response to Israel’s [targeting of the Hezbollah-linked financial firm al-Qard al-Hassan](/news/2024/10/21/israel-attacks-branches-of-hezbollah-linked-finance-group-in-lebanon)
, Afif said Hezbollah “had anticipated such … an aggression and has taken all precautions and will do everything that is necessary to fulfil its obligations towards depositors”.

After Saturday’s drone attack on Netanyahu’s house, Israel launched several air attacks on Beirut’s southern suburbs and has continued to since.

On September 23, Israel launched an [intense bombardment of Lebanon](/news/2024/10/21/us-says-it-is-seeking-lasting-end-to-war-in-lebanon-as-soon-as-possible)
 and later sent in ground forces after nearly a year of cross-border exchanges of fire with Hezbollah.

More than 2,500 people have been killed in Israeli attacks on Lebanon since October 2023, according to Lebanese health authorities.

From [Source](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahus-office-confirms-israel-was-behind-devastating-pager-attacks-on-hezbollah/): 
Content: "(AP Photo)

A spokesperson for Prime Minster Benjamin Netanyahu’s office confirmed to media outlets on Monday for the first time that Israel was behind a string of devastating attacks on Hezbollah communications devices in September.

During a cabinet meeting on Sunday, Netanyahu reportedly boasted that Israel was behind the attacks, but while the Jewish state was widely believed to have been responsible, there had been no official confirmation from the government or military until spokesman Omer Dostri’s statement on Monday.

[On September 17, thousands of pagers simultaneously exploded](https://www.timesofisrael.com/several-killed-thousands-hurt-as-wave-of-pager-explosions-strikes-hezbollah/)
 in the southern suburbs of Beirut and other Hezbollah strongholds across Lebanon.

The coordinated attack dealt a deadly blow to the Iran-backed Lebanese terror group, and kicked off an escalation that continued with the assassination of almost all of Hezbollah’s leadership, including Secretary General Hassan Nasrallah, and a limited Israeli ground invasion of southern Lebanon.

A Hezbollah official, speaking on condition of anonymity, had said the incident was the “biggest security breach” for the group in nearly a year of conflict with Israel.

Netanyahu office says Israeli cabinet approved ceasefire deal between Israel, Hezbollah
=======================================================================================

ByJordana Miller [!ABCNews logo <image:2319>](https://abc7.com/15590173/)

Wednesday, November 27, 2024

![Ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah in Lebanon begins](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

Josh Einiger has details on the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hezbollah.

LONDON -- Israel's cabinet has approved the U.S.-backed ceasefire proposal between Israel and Hezbollah after prolonged negotiations.

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had submitted the proposal to the cabinet for approval Tuesday evening local time. local time, Biden said.

"Israel appreciates the US contribution to the process, and reserves its right to act against any threat to its security," the Israeli Prime Minister's Office said, translated from Hebrew.

Netanyahu said earlier, when submitting the deal for approval, that the deal still relies on the actions of Hezbollah.

"The duration of the ceasefire depends on what happens in Lebanon," Netanyahu said in a statement. We will continue together until victory."

**SEE ALSO:** [Hezbollah's spokesman killed in rare Israeli strike on central Beirut, official says](https://6abc.com/post/hezbollahs-spokesman-mohammed-afif-killed-rare-israeli-strike-central-beirut-official-says/15552959/)

The prime minister hailed "great achievements" on all fronts of the war, including killing Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah and destroying their weapons across the country.

"With full understanding with the United States, we maintain complete military freedom of action," Netanyahu said in the address, translated from Hebrew. If it launches a rocket, if it digs a tunnel, if it brings in a truck with missiles -- we will attack."

Netanyahu attended a meeting with security officials on Sunday night regarding a ceasefire with Israel's Hezbollah adversaries in Lebanon, an Israeli official told ABC News.

This was part of ongoing talks, including Netanyahu's meeting last week in Israel with U.S. Hochstein also traveled to Beirut to discuss a potential way forward.

Netanyahu then held a security cabinet meeting on Tuesday morning to discuss the deal and hold a cabinet vote, Israeli officials said.

In October, Israel invaded southern Lebanon in an escalation of the ongoing conflict between Israel and the Hezbollah militant group.

Tensions heightened last weekend as the countries' leaders worked to negotiate a ceasefire deal. "If Hezbollah violates the agreement and tries to arm itself -- we will attack. On Sunday, Hezbollah fired about 250 rockets and other projectiles into Israel in one of the group's heaviest retaliations in months.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.



## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo of Benjamin Netanyahu is from 2009. The article was published 1 day ago.

## Decision Options
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:56> This image shows Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu inside his office and was captured and published by Hezbollah in August 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:56>)
web_search("Hezbollah Benjamin Netanyahu office")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
From [Source](https://pesacheck.org/altered-this-photo-of-a-drone-surveilling-pm-netanyahu-is-fabricated-396f43e817da): Found exact image on website with title: ALTERED: This photo of a drone surveilling PM Netanyahu is ...
Content: The search result from PesaCheck states that the image <image:56> is fabricated. The original photo of Benjamin Netanyahu is from 2009. The article was published 1 day ago.


### Evidence from `web_search`
Al Jazeera reported on October 22, 2024, that Hezbollah claimed responsibility for a drone attack on Benjamin Netanyahu's holiday residence, according to Mohammad Afif. The Times of Israel reported that Israel was behind attacks on Hezbollah communications devices in September 2024. ABC News published on November 27, 2024, discussing a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hezbollah, which Benjamin Netanyahu submitted.

*   [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/22/hezbollah-takes-responsibility-for-drone-attack-on-netanyahu-holiday-home](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/10/22/hezbollah-takes-responsibility-for-drone-attack-on-netanyahu-holiday-home)
*   [https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahus-office-confirms-israel-was-behind-devastating-pager-attacks-on-hezbollah/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/netanyahus-office-confirms-israel-was-behind-devastating-pager-attacks-on-hezbollah/)
*   [https://6abc.com/15590173](https://6abc.com/15590173)

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

Claim date: October 29, 2020

```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```


SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "For the assassination on July 31, 2024, Israeli intelligence tracked Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh through WhatsApp."

## Actions
```
web_search("Ismail Haniyeh assassination July 31 2024")
web_search("Israeli intelligence Hamas leader WhatsApp")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

2024 assassination of Hamas leader in Tehran, Iran

| Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh |     |

| Part of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")<br>, the [2024 Iran–Israel conflict](/wiki/2024_Iran%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "2024 Iran–Israel conflict")<br>, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)") |     |
| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_(cropped).jpg)<br><br>Haniyeh (left) meeting with the [Supreme Leader of Iran](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran "Supreme Leader of Iran")<br> [Ali Khamenei](/wiki/Ali_Khamenei "Ali Khamenei")<br> (right) hours before his death |     |

| Location | [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")<br>, [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran") |
| [Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system") | [35°49′10″N 51°24′57″E﻿ / ﻿35.81944°N 51.41583°E﻿ / 35.81944; 51.41583](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh&params=35_49_10_N_51_24_57_E_) |
| Date | 31 July 2024  <br>~2:00 a.m.[\[1\]](#cite_note-time-1)<br> ([IRST](/wiki/Iran_Standard_Time "Iran Standard Time")<br>) |
| Target | [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")<br> [**X**](/wiki/Assassination "Assassination") |
| Attack type | [Explosion](/wiki/Explosion "Explosion")<br> or [projectile attack](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile")<br> (disputed)[\[a\]](#cite_note-4) |
| Deaths | Ismail Haniyeh  <br>Wassim Abu Shaaban |
| Perpetrator | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel") |

On 31 July 2024, [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")
, the political leader of [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
, was assassinated along with his personal bodyguard in the Iranian capital [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")
 by an [Israeli](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 attack.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
 Haniyeh was killed in his accommodation in a military-run guesthouse after attending the inauguration ceremony for Iranian president [Masoud Pezeshkian](/wiki/Masoud_Pezeshkian "Masoud Pezeshkian")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
, the spokesman of the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 of [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran")
, condemned this assassination and said that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)

The cause of Haniyeh's death is under investigation by Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC).[\[8\]](#cite_note-9)
 Differing reports emerged as to how he was killed, ranging from a missile strike[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 to a remotely detonated explosive device previously hidden in his bedroom at the IRGC-run guesthouse.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:4-2)
 According to analysts, the assassination exposed critical security flaws.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)
[\[10\]](#cite_note-:9-11)
 The investigation has led to the arrest of over two dozen individuals, including senior intelligence and military officials, as well as staff from the guesthouse.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)

Haniyeh was a prominent figure within Hamas since the organization's founding in 1987. Haniyeh was the highest-ranking Hamas political leader killed since the start of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

Background
----------

### Ismail Haniyeh

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_(cropped).jpg)

, leader of [Palestinian Islamic Jihad](/wiki/Palestinian_Islamic_Jihad "Palestinian Islamic Jihad")
, and a group of men posing with a model of the [Dome of the Rock](/wiki/Dome_of_the_Rock "Dome of the Rock")
.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)

### Killings of Hamas officials

In response to the [October 7 attack](/wiki/October_7_attack "October 7 attack")
, Israel stated it would target Hamas leaders.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)
 On 2 January 2024, Hamas deputy [Saleh al-Arouri](/wiki/Saleh_al-Arouri "Saleh al-Arouri")
 was [assassinated](/wiki/Assassination_of_Saleh_al-Arouri "Assassination of Saleh al-Arouri")
 in an airstrike in [Beirut](/wiki/Beirut "Beirut")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-j076-19)
 On 13 July 2024, Israel attempted to assassinate Hamas military chief [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")
, with the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 announcing his death on 1 August.[\[19\]](#cite_note-20)
 Hours before Haniyeh's death, Israel announced the [assassination of Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Killing_of_Fuad_Shukr "Killing of Fuad Shukr")
, a senior [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
 leader in Beirut.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

Assassination
-------------

The initial report of Ismail Haniyeh's killing emerged from Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC), who provided limited specifics regarding the circumstances of his death, which it said occurred early on 31 July and indicated that the incident was under investigation. Ismail Haniyeh")
**

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Commons-logo.svg)
 Media related to [Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh "commons:Category:Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh")
 at Wikimedia Commons

[Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")

Part of the [Gaza–Israel conflict](/wiki/Gaza%E2%80%93Israel_conflict "Gaza–Israel conflict")
, the [Israeli–Palestinian conflict](/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict "Israeli–Palestinian conflict")
, and the [Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)](/wiki/Middle_Eastern_crisis_(2023%E2%80%93present) "Middle Eastern crisis (2023–present)")

Nations

| Resolutions | *   [A/RES/ES-10/21](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/21 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/21")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2712](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2712 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2712")<br>    <br>*   [A/RES/ES-10/22](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/22 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/22")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2720](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2720 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2720")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2728](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2728 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2728")<br>    <br>*   [A/RES/ES-10/23](/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_Resolution_ES-10/23 "United Nations General Assembly Resolution ES-10/23")<br>    <br>*   [S/RES/2735](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_Resolution_2735 "United Nations Security Council Resolution 2735") |
| Inquiry | *   [Independent International Commission of Inquiry on the Occupied Palestinian Territory](/wiki/Independent_International_Commission_of_Inquiry_on_the_Occupied_Palestinian_Territory "Independent International Commission of Inquiry on the Occupied Palestinian Territory") |

Courts

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Global courts | *   [_South Africa v. He also called for the Palestinian people to unite.[\[20\]](#cite_note-arabiya-21)
[\[85\]](#cite_note-89)
 Palestine's deputy permanent observer to the United Nations, Feda Abdelhady Nasser, called on the international community to stop Israel from dragging the Middle East into the "abyss".[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 Former [PLO](/wiki/Palestine_Liberation_Organization "Palestine Liberation Organization")
 member [Hanan Ashrawi](/wiki/Hanan_Ashrawi "Hanan Ashrawi")
 said that Israel's "gangster style" assassination of Haniyeh was made to "inflame the whole region".[\[87\]](#cite_note-91)

Hamas said that it mourned the death of Haniyeh, who it said was killed in "a treacherous Zionist raid on his residence".[\[88\]](#cite_note-x734-92)
 Senior Hamas official [Mousa Abu Marzook](/wiki/Mousa_Abu_Marzook "Mousa Abu Marzook")
 said that Haniyeh's assassination was "a cowardly act that will not pass in vain".[\[89\]](#cite_note-c729-93)
 Another senior official, [Sami Abu Zuhri](/wiki/Sami_Abu_Zuhri "Sami Abu Zuhri")
, accused Israel of killing Haniyeh, stating that it aims to break the will of Hamas and the Palestinians.[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 Hamas's military wing, the Al-Qassam Brigades, called the assassination a "dangerous event" that will have "major repercussions across the entire region".[\[91\]](#cite_note-95)

Palestinian Islamic Jihad released a statement saying that it "mourns with the Palestinian people and the Arab and [Islamic nation](/wiki/Ummah "Ummah")
" for the death of Haniyeh.[\[92\]](#cite_note-:0-96)

On 2 August, former [Grand Mufti of Jerusalem](/wiki/Grand_Mufti_of_Jerusalem "Grand Mufti of Jerusalem")
 Sheikh [Ekrima Sa'id Sabri](/wiki/Ekrima_Sa%27id_Sabri "Ekrima Sa'id Sabri")
 was arrested by Israeli police on suspicion of inciting "terrorism" after calling Haniyeh a "martyr" during a sermon in [East Jerusalem](/wiki/East_Jerusalem "East Jerusalem")
.[\[93\]](#cite_note-97)

### Iran

Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei held an emergency Supreme National Security Council meeting with top Iranian officials following the assassination.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)
 Khamenei later stated that "With this action, the criminal and [terrorist](/wiki/Israel_and_state-sponsored_terrorism "Israel and state-sponsored terrorism")
 [Zionist regime](/wiki/Zionist_regime "Zionist regime")
 prepared the ground for harsh punishment for itself, and we consider it our duty to seek revenge for his blood as he was [martyred](/wiki/Shahid "Shahid")
 in the territory of the Islamic Republic of Iran".[\[94\]](#cite_note-c453-98)
 _The New York Times_, citing Iranian officials, reported that he ordered direct strikes against Israel in response to the assassination.[\[43\]](#cite_note-nyt31jul-44)
[\[95\]](#cite_note-99)
 [Foreign Ministry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 spokesman [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
 condemned the assassination, stating that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)
 President Masoud Pezeshkian condemned the assassination and said Iran will defend its territorial integrity and make those responsible regret their actions.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 The government announced three days of public mourning for Haniyeh.[\[96\]](#cite_note-100)
 At the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
, Iran's ambassador [Amir Saeid Iravani](/wiki/Amir_Saeid_Iravani "Amir Saeid Iravani")
, called on the [UN Security Council](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council "United Nations Security Council")
 to condemn Israel and said that Iran had a right to respond in self-defence to the killing, which he described as part of "Israel's decades-long pattern of terrorism and sabotage targeting Palestinians and other supporters of the Palestinian cause across the region and beyond." He also accused the United States of responsibility over the assassination.[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 The chief of staff of the [Iranian armed forces](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran_Armed_Forces "Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces")
, [Mohammad Bagheri](/wiki/Mohammad_Bagheri_(general) "Mohammad Bagheri (general)")
, suggested that the response could come as part of a coordinated effort with the [Axis of Resistance](/wiki/Axis_of_Resistance "Axis of Resistance")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)

The [Tehran Stock Exchange](/wiki/Tehran_Stock_Exchange "Tehran Stock Exchange")
 fell 1.9%.[\[97\]](#cite_note-101)
 Iran's chief prosecutor warned journalists against "spreading rumours".[\[98\]](#cite_note-102)

A red flag was hoisted above the [Jamkaran Mosque](/wiki/Jamkaran_Mosque "Jamkaran Mosque")
 in [Qom](/wiki/Qom "Qom")
 and the [Milad Tower](/wiki/Milad_Tower "Milad Tower")
 in Tehran was lit up in red overnight.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)
 A large banner was placed in Tehran's Palestine Square, featuring a portrait of Haniyeh alongside the Dome of the Rock, with a message in [Farsi](/wiki/Persian_language "Persian language")
 and [Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_language "Hebrew language")
 reading: 'Wait for severe punishment.'"[\[99\]](#cite_note-103)

Opposition figures [Masih Alinejad](/wiki/Masih_Alinejad "Masih Alinejad")
, [Hamed Esmaeilion](/wiki/Hamed_Esmaeilion "Hamed Esmaeilion")
 and [Reza Pahlavi](/wiki/Reza_Pahlavi,_Crown_Prince_of_Iran "Reza Pahlavi, Crown Prince of Iran")
 called the killing of Haniyeh the sign of iniquity of the Iranian regime.[\[100\]](#cite_note-104)
[\[101\]](#cite_note-105)
[\[102\]](#cite_note-106)

### Israel

The Israel Defense Forces told [CNN](/wiki/CNN "CNN")
 they "don't respond to reports in the foreign media".[\[103\]](#cite_note-107)
 The IDF did not release new security guidelines for civilians.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 Heritage Minister [Amihai Eliyahu](/wiki/Amihai_Eliyahu "Amihai Eliyahu")
 praised the assassination, saying that it "makes the world a little better",[\[104\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 and that killing him was "the right way to cleanse the world from this filth."[\[105\]](#cite_note-109)
[\[106\]](#cite_note-110)
 Israel increased security measures at its diplomatic missions and Jewish sites worldwide.[\[107\]](#cite_note-111)
 The security of [Israel's delegation](/wiki/Israel_at_the_2024_Summer_Olympics "Israel at the 2024 Summer Olympics")
 in the [2024 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics "2024 Summer Olympics")
 was increased due to fears of potential attacks.[\[108\]](#cite_note-112)
 Then-Defense Minister [Yoav Gallant](/wiki/Yoav_Gallant "Yoav Gallant")
 addressed troops at an [Arrow](/wiki/Arrow_(missile_family) "Arrow (missile family)")
 missile air-defense battery, stating, "We don't want war, but we are preparing for all possibilities."[\[109\]](#cite_note-113)
 In December 2024, Defense Minister [Israel Katz](/wiki/Israel_Katz "Israel Katz")
 confirmed Israel's responsibility in the assassination of Haniyeh while delivering a threat to the Yemeni [Houthi movement](/wiki/Houthi_movement "Houthi movement")
, stating, "We will strike \[the Houthis'\] strategic infrastructure and decapitate its leaders. Just as we did to Haniyeh, [Sinwar](/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar "Killing of Yahya Sinwar")
, and [Nasrallah](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")
, in Tehran, Gaza, and Lebanon—we will do in [Hodeidah](/wiki/Al_Hudaydah "Al Hudaydah")
 and [Sanaa](/wiki/Sanaa "Sanaa")
."[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
[\[110\]](#cite_note-114)

### International

The United Nations Security Council held an emergency session on 31 July following the assassination, during which China, Russia and Algeria condemned the killing. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731123456/https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/31/middleeast/analysis-iran-options-ismail-haniyeh-killing-intl/index.html)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731041436/https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/hamas-political-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed-in-iran-5723ad8b?mod=hp_lead_pos1)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731034454/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/31/hamass-political-chief-ismail-haniyeh-assassinated-in-iran-state-media)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731040020/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2024/07/31/israel-hamas-war-latest-news-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed/)
     from the original on 31 July 2024."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh on July 31, 2024, in Tehran, Iran. <image:i>, <image:j>. The attack was carried out by Israel. The article does not mention any information about Israeli intelligence tracking Haniyeh through WhatsApp.
